page.title: 15Whittington Moor Industries
page.content: Chesterfield has been a market town since 1204 but its main development has been as an industrial town. This is because there are coal mines around the town & also supplies of iron ore. Although there are no furnaces now and the work force much reduced at the big engineering works of Sheepbridge,Bryan Donkin, Staveley and Markham there has sprung up many small firms based on the engineering, iron & steel industr- ies. On Whittington Moor we have: Metapic who pickle & clean s/steel. Fastnaparts who make nuts and bolts. Chesterfield Special Steels Ltd. who are steel stockholders. The Valley Spring Co.Ltd. who make coil springs of all sizes. Ryro Engineering Co. who manufacture parts for earth-moving equipment. Oswald Record repair pneumatic tools. Alloy Steel & Iron Co. make castings.
